ibbt.sumo.sampleevaluators
Interface SampleEvaluator

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicSampleEvaluator, BatchSampleEvaluator, DatasetSampleEvaluator, DefaultSampleEvaluator, DistributedSampleEvaluator, GriddedDatasetSampleEvaluator, LocalSampleEvaluator, MatlabSampleEvaluator, RemoteSGESampleEvaluator, ScatteredDatasetSampleEvaluator, ThreadedBasicSampleEvaluator, ThreadedBatchSampleEvaluator
public interface SampleEvaluator

Interface to an entity that is able to evaluate sample points

Method Summary
 void cleanup()
          Clean up the threads started and the resources used by the sample evaluator.
 SamplePoint fetchEvaluatedSample()
          Get the next evaluated point
 double getAverageEvaluationTime()
          Get the average time in seconds to simulate one data point
 int getNumEvaluatedSamples()
          Return the number of samples that have already been evaluated and are waiting to be fetched
 int getNumPendingSamples()
          Return the number of samples pending evaluation
 SampleEvaluatorStatus getStatus()
          Get the status of the sample evaluator.
 void submitSamplesForEvaluation(SamplePoint[] points)
          Schedule a number of sample points for evaluation
 

Method Detail

submitSamplesForEvaluation

void submitSamplesForEvaluation(SamplePoint[] points)
Schedule a number of sample points for evaluation

fetchEvaluatedSample

SamplePoint fetchEvaluatedSample()
Get the next evaluated point

getNumPendingSamples

int getNumPendingSamples()
Return the number of samples pending evaluation

getNumEvaluatedSamples

int getNumEvaluatedSamples()
Return the number of samples that have already been evaluated and are waiting to be fetched

getAverageEvaluationTime

double getAverageEvaluationTime()
Get the average time in seconds to simulate one data point

cleanup

void cleanup()
Clean up the threads started and the resources used by the sample evaluator. Called automatically when the SampleEvaluator is not to be used anymore.

getStatus

SampleEvaluatorStatus getStatus()
Get the status of the sample evaluator. This status contains, for example, if the sample evaluator is still capable of evaluating samples and how many it can evaluate at once.

Returns:
The status.
